title: Career opportunities in IT security.
excerpt: Covers high demand, flexible work setups, key team roles (Red vs. Blue), the role of the Security Operations Center (SOC), and the fundamental three pillars of cybersecurity.

title: CIA Triad and Information Assurance
excerpt: Details the core model of information security (CIA Triad) and the general practice of Information Assurance.

title: Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) and HTTPS Trust
excerpt: Explains PKI, components like CA and CSR, and the process of establishing trust for secure HTTPS communication.

title: Web Application Basics: HTTP and Targeted Ports
excerpt: Covers fundamental HTTP Request Methods (GET, POST, PUT, HEAD, OPTIONS) and common network ports (443, 3389, 5650) targeted by attackers during a hack.

title: OWASP Top 10 (2021) and XSS Payloads
excerpt: Introduces the Open Web Application Security Project (OWASP) and details key vulnerabilities from the 2021 Top 10 list, including Broken Access Control and Injection, along with XSS payload examples.

title: OS Command Injection Attacks
excerpt: Focuses on OS Command Injectionâ€”a critical vulnerability that allows an adversary to execute arbitrary system commands, leading to full machine compromise. Includes prevention techniques.

title: Malware Types and Analysis Methods
excerpt: A detailed look into common malicious software like Ransomware, Viruses, and Trojans, along with the two primary methods used by analysts to study their behavior: Static vs. Dynamic Analysis.

title: Vulnerability Cataloging and Exploit Tools
excerpt: A brief overview of systems used to catalog and track security vulnerabilities and exploits.

title: IT Security and Information Assurance
excerpt: Explains the critical role of IT Security and the comprehensive practice of Information Assurance (IA) in protecting systems and managing risks.

title: Threat Actors, TTPs, and Phishing
excerpt: Details the main goal of studying Threat Actors and their TTPs (Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures), including common methods like Phishing, and defines the different types of malicious actors.

title: Breaches & Incidents
excerpt: Provides context on notable real-world data breaches and security violations in the Philippines, including the COMELEC hack and recent incidents involving major companies.

title: Cloud Computing and Virtualization Concepts
excerpt: Explains hypervisor types (Bare-metal and Hosted), Content Delivery Networks (CDN), various Cloud Deployment Models, and the function of a Cloud Access Security Broker (CASB).

title: Digital Forensics and Incident Response (DFIR)
excerpt: Details the four main areas of forensic analysis: File System Analysis, Network Logs, System Logs, and System Memory.

title: Encryption Fundamentals
excerpt: Covers the four principles of cryptography, differences between symmetric and asymmetric ciphers, the Diffie-Hellman key exchange, and the roles of Certificate Authorities and X.509 certificates.

title: CWE-79: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) Details
excerpt: Detailed explanation of CWE-79, how XSS works, the three main types of XSS (Reflected, Stored, DOM-Based), and the resulting attack consequences.

title: CWE-35: Path Traversal Attack
excerpt: Explains the Path Traversal (or Directory Traversal) vulnerability, how it uses the '..' symbol to escape restricted directories, the impact of the attack, and prevention methods.

title: Network Traffic Analysis and Wireshark
excerpt: Introduction to Network Traffic Analysis, the OSI model, and the use of Wireshark for deep packet inspection, including filters and stream following.
